column2: LOUISIANA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column8: speedgating.

column2: 2. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column6: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column8: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column10: Only if the light is green.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right
column8: Do not pass

column2: 4. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column8: A No Passing Zone

column2: 5. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.
column8: in a tunnel.

column2: 6. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column6: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.

column2: 7. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column6: quickly change speed or lane position.
column8: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.

column2: 8. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column8: Air bag only
column10: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 9. This sign warns drivers that:
column8: a shared lane starts ahead.
column10: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 10. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column8: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 11. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.
column8: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column8: Winding road

column2: 13. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column8: emergency flashers.

column2: 14. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column10: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 15. ABS is the acronym for:
column8: Anti-Braking System

column2: 16. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 17. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.
column10: get off the road and check your tires.

column2: 18. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column6: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 19. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive with the flow of traffic.
column6: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
column8: maintain a constant speed.
column10: drive slower than the flow of traffic.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column8: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection
column10: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary

column2: 21. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: The car on your right.

column2: 22. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column8: truck

column2: 23. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column6: go to the next entrance ramp.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column8: No U-turns
column10: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic

column2: 25. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column6: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column8: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column10: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.

column2: 26. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column6: they must not make a right turn.
column8: U-turns are not allowed.

column2: 27. This road sign indicates that:
column4: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column6: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column8: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.

column2: 28. When you see this sign you should:
column4: increase your speed and try to pass other vehicles.
column6: slow your speed and be prepared to stop.
column8: slow your speed and do not pass other vehicles.
column10: prepare to slow down and possibly yield to oncoming traffic.

column2: 29. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
30. This road sign means:
column8: T-intersection ahead

column2: 31. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column6: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column8: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column10: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 32. A speed restriction sign:
column8: shows the recommended speed for a curve/turn.
column10: must be ignored in snow conditions.

column2: 33. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column8: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.

column2: 34. Directions given by traffic officers ___________ signs, signals or pavement markings.
column8: take precedence over

column2: 35. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column6: You should look over your shoulder instead.
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 36. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column8: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column10: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction

column2: 37. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: there is a double curve ahead.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 38. A red traffic sign means?
column8: Stop.

column2: 39. This road sign means:
column8: Slow down or stop

column2: 40. This road sign means:
column4: All traffic must turn right at the next intersection
column8: A left turn can be made only after stopping
